results.title: A Whaling voyage
results.creator_credit: Education Development Center Film Studio and John Friedman
results.brief_description: Shows the preparation and the voyage of a whaling ship working under sail, killing and rendering a large whale. Contains an excerpt from a 1922 feature - Elmer Clifton’s “Down to the sea in ships”.

results.title: A Wet tale (K)
results.brief_description: An animated adventure featuring a small droplet of water. The story is an amusing one and it is also educational, giving very young viewers their first glimpse of the recycling of water on earth.

results.title: A Well known stranger
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Vincent Tovell
results.brief_description: The human brain and attempts to understand its function. Covers a wide range of investigations, showing study of structure and physiology, electrical phenomena, localisation, animal and human learning experiments, sensation and sleep.

results.title: A Way of caring
results.brief_description: A record of a typical day in the lives of a group of seventeen severely mentally handicapped children who live in a small hostel on the outskirts of a large provincial town. Shows how the individual attention of the six housemothers and the home atmosphere of the hostel, is reflected in the children’s behaviour.

results.title: A Warehouse for bodies
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Andy Thomson and Allan Goldstein
results.brief_description: Life inside a prison in Canada, the Kingston Maximum Security Penitentiary, as seen by the guards and the inmates. Interviews with prisoners and guards paint a harsh picture. The day is punctuated with the sound of metal, and violence runs dangerously close to the surface. A useful film that explains the high degree of recidivism in a sub-culture that operates by a code of its own.

results.title: A Waltz through the hills
results.creator_credit: Barron Films, Paul D. Barron, Roz Berrystone and Frank Arnold
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by G.M. Glaskin, this multi-award winning adventure is about two young children who, after their mother dies, decide to run-away to England to stay with their only surviving relatives to avoid being put in separate orphanages. The first stage of the journey involves walking 107 kilometres from an inland West Australian wheat belt town to perth. They are befriended by a young aboriginal man and his family, survive a bush-fire, eat off the land and eventually reach Perth to media and public acclaim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barron Films, Paul D. Barron, Roz Berrystone and Frank Arnold

results.title: A Walk in the Sun
results.brief_description: Powerful and bold in its story, ‘A Walk in the Sun’ is unforgettable in its drama. The masterful director of “All Quiet on the Western Front” has again captured the deepest emotions of men at war.

results.title: A Walk in the park
results.brief_description: A film designed to stimulate discussion amount young people on the problem of drug abuse. It presents the momentary world to three young people, whose life style may appear rather unorthodox. The film presents non-moralizing, realistic episode open to a wide range of interpretations.

results.title: A Walk in the forest
results.brief_description: Based on an incident which occurred during oil exploration in Papua New Guinea. Two Australian geologists were working in an unknown area. After an argument with an old native woman, Boro, one of the natives on the survey fell sick with pneumonia. He believed she had put a curse on him. He had to be taken out of the jungle, by foot, canoe and eventually aircraft, and taken to hospital 300 miles away in Port Moresby.
